content:
• Tuesday, July 12, 2011
  • EA

    Along with announcing what may be a billion-dollar deal for PopCap, Electronic Arts (ERTS)...

    Along with announcing what may be a billion-dollar deal for PopCap, Electronic Arts (ERTS) offered some mixed guidance, raising revenue estimates for the year - and for just-ended FQ1 to $500M-525M, from $460M-500M, vs. a consensus of $490M; and it sees a narrower FQ1 loss of $0.37-0.40 per share vs. expected loss of $0.45 - but an unexpected current-quarter loss of $0.05-$0.15/share. ERTS now -3.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • TSL

    On a bad day for solar stocks, Trina Solar (TSL -9.8%) is getting hit harder than most, after...

    On a bad day for solar stocks, Trina Solar (TSL -9.8%) is getting hit harder than most, after announcing that the head of its audit committee, Peter Mak, is resigning from the board. However, Raymond James sees Mak's departure as a positive, noting his involvement with A-Power Energy (NASDAQ:APWR), which has been hit by accounting woes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • INFI

    Shares of Infinity Pharmaceuticals (INFI +9.6%) pop on above-average volume as the company...

    Shares of Infinity Pharmaceuticals (INFI +9.6%) pop on above-average volume as the company expands its program to develop new cancer drugs, buying nuisance weeds in western states, unwanted by landowners, but needed by the firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • IPSU

    Imperial Sugar (NASDAQ:IPSU) is a beneficiary of today's jump in sugar prices, gaining +9.8% on...

    Imperial Sugar (NASDAQ:IPSU) is a beneficiary of today's jump in sugar prices, gaining +9.8% on higher-than-average volume. The stock has risen +80% over the past three months as the price of sugar climbs, and spreads between raw and refined sugar continue to widen.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (APOL +3.6%) gets a lift after the University of Phoenix is cleared by its...

    Apollo Group (APOL +3.6%) gets a lift after the University of Phoenix is cleared by its accrediting body following an investigation of the school's admissions, recruiting and financial-aid procedures.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • NVLS-OLD

    Already dinged by Novellus (NVLS-OLD -11.4%), Applied Materials (AMAT -2.9%)  is providing...

    Already dinged by Novellus (NVLS-OLD -11.4%), Applied Materials (AMAT -2.9%)  is providing more bad news for chip equipment firms: the company is cutting its 2011 chip equipment spending outlook, citing weak spending from DRAM makers and foundries. The cut makes plenty of sense in the wake of Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and TSMC's (NYSE:TSM) recent results.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • CDTI

    Emission-control maker Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +65%) soars after Roth initiates...

    Emission-control maker Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +65%) soars after Roth initiates coverage with a buy and sets a $9 price target, more than double Monday's close. It's worth noting that volume and price activity picked up significantly once shares moved above $5.00, a key threshold where institutions can buy the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta (MLM +1.4%) receives an upgrade to Buy from Neutral from Davenport, and trades...

    Martin Marietta (MLM +1.4%) receives an upgrade to Buy from Neutral from Davenport, and trades higher on above average volume. The firm ranks in the top 5 of its industry for the level of cash it carries on its books.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • OWW

    Orbitz (OWW +10.7%) trades higher after announcing late yesterday it had entered into a...

    Orbitz (OWW +10.7%) trades higher after announcing late yesterday it had entered into a partnership with Virgin Australia to provide hotel bookings for the airline's Australian websites. The deal allows Virgin customers to search and book more than 71,000 hotel properties across the globe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR), up over 175% this year, are down 4.5% on a Stifel...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR), up over 175% this year, are down 4.5% on a Stifel Nicholas report that the company's market share of its K-Cup coffee grounds is declining at the hands of J.M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) brands. Further share declines might occur as Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) begin rolling out K-Cups this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • FSLR

    Shares of solar companies, both in the U.S. and China, take a beating on margin warnings, and...

    Shares of solar companies, both in the U.S. and China, take a beating on margin warnings, and more flare-ups from scrutiny on the accounting practices of Chinese companies listing in the U.S. Losers: FSLR -2.4%, YGE -4%, JASO -4.9%, TSL -12%, LDK -5.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • WTFC

    Wintrust Financial (WTFC +4.75%) holds on to gains following a Baird upgrade earlier in the day....

    Wintrust Financial (WTFC +4.75%) holds on to gains following a Baird upgrade earlier in the day. The firm says the market has "failed to recognize the attractiveness" of the company's acquisition of First Chicago. The purchase is accretive to earnings, and gives it greater exposure to the Chicago market.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • MCHP

    Earnings season began with a thud in tech land (I, II), as lower guidance from chip maker...

    Earnings season began with a thud in tech land (I, II), as lower guidance from chip maker Microchip Technology (MCHP -12.8%) and equipment maker Novellus (NVLS-OLD -11.3%) sinks the semiconductor sector (SMH -3.3%). S&P sees signs that "excess chip inventories may be building up in the electronics supply chain, which in turn could hurt semiconductor device demand down the road."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN -3.9%) moves a step closer to FDA approval, but shares stumble after the...

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN -3.9%) moves a step closer to FDA approval, but shares stumble after the FDA files documents (.pdf) asking questions about the extent of the research done on the firm's blood cancer drug.  Medical experts will issue a recommendation to the FDA on Thursday, and a final decision date is set for Aug. 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • TFIFF

    Vitran (VTNC -10%) continues to trade lower after announcing earlier that it expects to incur a...

    Vitran (VTNC -10%) continues to trade lower after announcing earlier that it expects to incur a loss for Q2 versus a previously anticipated gain. The transportation and freight supply operator notes outstanding performance within its Canadian business unit was eclipsed by poor operating results from its U.S counterpart.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • QSFT

    Quest Software (QSFT -12%) hovers near its lows for the day after cutting Q2 revenue estimates...

    Quest Software (QSFT -12%) hovers near its lows for the day after cutting Q2 revenue estimates this morning. The comany says the reduced numbers reflect a delayed return on recent acquisitions and other investments in its business. It now expects Q2 revenue between $201M and $204M, below previous guidance of $204M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • NCR

    Shares of Radiant Systems (RADS +30.4%) stay near their opening price, and shrug off an...

    Shares of Radiant Systems (RADS +30.4%) stay near their opening price, and shrug off an announcement a law firm is investigating the company in connection with the proposed acquisition by NCR Corporation (NCR -0.8%) announced last night. The company is the biggest advancer in the Russell 2000.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • RUE

    Rue21 (RUE -4.7%) trades lower after Nomura cuts it to neutral on valuation. The firm notes that...

    Rue21 (RUE -4.7%) trades lower after Nomura cuts it to neutral on valuation. The firm notes that it continues to like the company's long-term competitive positioning, but the stock has gained 32% since June and further near-term upside is limited.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • GSG

    The S&P GSCI (GSG +0.1%) index of commodities is flat, but sugar prices jump +4% after the...

    The S&P GSCI (GSG +0.1%) index of commodities is flat, but sugar prices jump +4% after the USDA releases its Agricultural Supply and Demand Estimates showing sugar stocks moving lower. (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SEE

    Sealed Air (SEE +3%) gets a boost from an upgrade at Barclays. The firm says Wall Street has...

    Sealed Air (SEE +3%) gets a boost from an upgrade at Barclays. The firm says Wall Street has been overly pessimistic of the company's planned acquisition of cleaning solutions company Diversey Holdings. The purchase will actually generate strong free cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM

  • The CBOE Volatility Index wakes up, +5.5% for the day, as it makes a slow march towards the...

    The CBOE Volatility Index wakes up, +5.5% for the day, as it makes a slow march towards the psychologically-important 20 mark. The index remains well-below the panic levels seen in the aftermath of the financial crisis, surprising some traders.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 2 Comments
  • ESLRQ

    One-time high-flyer Evergreen Solar (ESLR) is down 31.2% after posting an 8-K filing warning any...

    One-time high-flyer Evergreen Solar (ESLR) is down 31.2% after posting an 8-K filing warning any restructuring of the company's debt "will involve very significant or complete dilution to the Company's existing stockholders." Evergreen reported in May that FQ1 revenues fell 60% sequentially.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • WWW

    Despite beating top-line Q2 estimates, Wolverine World Wide (WWW -9%) sells off over concerns...

    Despite beating top-line Q2 estimates, Wolverine World Wide (WWW -9%) sells off over concerns that momentum is slowing for the maker of Hush Puppies and other shoes. The company's order backlog for the reported quarter was just 13%, far below the 20% analysts were looking for.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN -2.8%) hits a low on the wake of a FQ1 warning from Microchip (MCHP...

    Texas Instruments (TXN -2.8%) hits a low on the wake of a FQ1 warning from Microchip (MCHP -12.5%), and a price target cut on shares from Nomura to $26 from $28. Adding to the misery, Nomura finds more downside risk for the firm relative to large-cap peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • TREX

    Decking manufacturer Trex (TREX -13%) takes a hit after saying its Q2 will be far lower than...

    Decking manufacturer Trex (TREX -13%) takes a hit after saying its Q2 will be far lower than estimates. The company blames the miss on poor weather delaying the start of the summer deck-building season. Revenues are now expected to be ~$78M, below previous guidance of $115M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • ADBE

    Adobe (ADBE -1.8%) trades lower after Goldman resumes coverage with a sell. The firm notes the...

    Adobe (ADBE -1.8%) trades lower after Goldman resumes coverage with a sell. The firm notes the company's product cycle is "moving the needle less and less," and its digital media business still struggles with transition issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • BGC

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC) is up 4.5% after Standard & Poor's announces the wire and cable...

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC) is up 4.5% after Standard & Poor's announces the wire and cable provider will be replacing SRA International (NYSE:SRX) in the S&P MidCap 400 index after the market's close on 7/15.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears (SHLD +2.4%) rise, joining the rally in retail stocks late. Could Sears be...

    Shares of Sears (SHLD +2.4%) rise, joining the rally in retail stocks late. Could Sears be looking for aggressive online growth? The firm is controlled by Edward Lampert, a hedge-fund investor reported to be sniffing around for web deals. Shares are the largest gainer on the NASDAQ-100.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE), a provider of liquified natural gas (LNG) to fuel...

    Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE), a provider of liquified natural gas (LNG) to fuel transportation fleets, is up 15.2% after Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) agrees to invest $150M in the company's bonds over the next 3 years, with the proceeds to be used to finance 150 LNG truck fueling stations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 6 Comments
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO -2.5%) trades lower after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts it to underperform. The firm says...

    Tesoro (TSO -2.5%) trades lower after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts it to underperform. The firm says Valero (VLO -1.4%) and Marathon Petroleum (MPC -1.2%) offer a better "combination of value, operational catalysts and earnings leverage" among large-cap refining companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • AAL

    Shares of airline stocks slip on Europe worries. Airliners face the usual Europe debt stress,...

    Shares of airline stocks slip on Europe worries. Airliners face the usual Europe debt stress, but are also in a fight with the EU over emission standards under a new proposal, starting next year, capping emissions at 97% of their average 2004-06 levels. Airline losers: American (AMR -2.3%), Delta (DAL -2.3%), United Continental (BAL -2.9%)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • MCHP

    In response to Microchip's (MCHP -13.6%) FQ1 warning, UBS is downgrading Microchip, Maxim...

    In response to Microchip's (MCHP -13.6%) FQ1 warning, UBS is downgrading Microchip, Maxim Integrated (MXIM -5.5%), and ON Semiconductor (ONNN -6%), believing chipmakers with heavy exposure to consumer electronics, PCs, and autos may be in trouble. Other analysts have also voiced concerns about the chip industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • SOL

    Solar wafer manufacturer ReneSola (SOL -6.6%) dips after saying Q2 revenue will be below...

    Solar wafer manufacturer ReneSola (SOL -6.6%) dips after saying Q2 revenue will be below estimates due to declining wafer prices and increasing competition. Revenue is now expected to be in the range of $235M to $245M, less than previous guidance of $280M to $300M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • CMI

    Engine maker Cummins (CMI +2%) boosts its dividend over 50% to $0.40 a share, adding to the...

    Engine maker Cummins (CMI +2%) boosts its dividend over 50% to $0.40 a share, adding to the growing number of companies rewarding shareholders by tapping into cash. "Cummins had its most profitable year in its history in 2010 and we expect that 2011 will be an even better year," says CEO Tim Solso.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • FAST

    More on Fastenal (NASDAQ:FAST): Q2 profits jumped 39% from Q1 as strong industrial sales...

    More on Fastenal (NASDAQ:FAST): Q2 profits jumped 39% from Q1 as strong industrial sales outweighed an increase in raw material and fuel costs.  After a 15% runup in its stock price since mid-June, the stock is seeing some profit-taking before the open. Shares -0.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) shares could be under pressure after Collins Stewart slashes its...

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) shares could be under pressure after Collins Stewart slashes its target price to $4.50 from $5.50, citing falling solar cell prices that have failed to stimulate additional demand. The firm’s revised forecast sees Q2 revenues of $400M, below consensus and a 28% Q/Q decline. JASO -2.3% premarket; also LDK -2.9%, STP -1.3%, FSLR -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • NCR

    Premarket gainers: RADS +30%. CLNE +12%. NWS +4%.Losers: MCHP -9%. SOL -8%. AMSC -6%. INFY -6%....

    Premarket gainers: RADS +30%. CLNE +12%. NWS +4%.
    Losers: MCHP -9%. SOL -8%. AMSC -6%. INFY -6%. NVLS-OLD -5%. PSTI -4%. AIB -4%. ONNN -3%. LDK -3%. GPOR -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
